meanings.sent1: After the trial was postponed, the witness retestified in court.
meanings.sent2: The expert retestified about the findings of the investigation.
meanings.sent3: The parrot retestified its favorite phrase to the amusement of the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her actions retestified her commitment to the cause.
meanings.sent5: The echo in the canyon retestified every word she shouted.

meanings.sent1: The victim bravely retestified about the incident in front of the jury.
meanings.sent2: The detective asked the witness to retestify to clarify some details.
meanings.sent3: The cat retestified its innocence by knocking over the vase again.
meanings.sent4: The old photograph retestified the memories of a bygone era.
meanings.sent5: The storm retestified the power of nature with each thunderous roar.
